title: A Good Example for a Bad Ministry

memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: Having a form of godliness but denying its power - 2 Timothy 3:5

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
Some people shine in personality but fail in purpose. They are disciplined, respectable, and admired yet their ministry lacks the heart of Christ. They guide, but not with grace. They speak truth, but without love. They demand loyalty, but not liberty.

They become good examples of what a bad ministry looks like — impressive in the flesh, but empty in the Spirit.

A true ministry gives freedom, not fear. It builds others, not buries their zeal. God never called us to control His people, but to serve them. When someone’s ministry silences the passion of others, they unknowingly stand against the work of the Holy Spirit.

Jesus said, “Whoever wants to be first must be your servant.” (Mark 9:35). Ministry is not about position, but submission. When we walk humbly, even quietly, the fragrance of Christ flows — that’s the mark of a good ministry.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: The measure of a ministry is not how many serve you, but how many you serve. — A. W. Tozer

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, keep me from prideful service. Teach me to serve with love, not control. Let my ministry carry Your presence, not my personality. Help me to lift others, not limit them. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May your hands never be heavy in serving.
May your heart always be light in loving.

recommended_book.label: Recommended Book
recommended_book.title: The Cost of Discipleship
recommended_book.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer
recommended_book.quote: Only the obedient believe, and only the believer obeys.
